intro: Thalictrum olympicum, commonly known as the Olympic meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest understories. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance. Thalictrum olympicum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
